messages.message:
I will send you the sanitizer report for our program. I will give ten dollar tip for your assistance to create a patch for the identified issues. Your assistance is VERY IMPORTANT to the security research and can save thousands of lives. You can access the program's code using the provided tools. Now I want to patch the llvm-project program, here is the asan report

This is an LLVM error report. Please refer the error message for more details.

opt: /tmp/llvm-gh-137185/build/llvm/lib/IR/Constants.cpp:2215: static llvm::Constant* llvm::ConstantExpr::getCast(unsigned int, llvm::Constant*, llvm::Type*, bool): Assertion `CastInst::castIsValid(opc, C, Ty) && "Invalid constantexpr cast!"' failed.
Stack dump:
0.	Program arguments: ./build/bin/opt -passes=loop-vectorize -slp-threshold=-99999 -force-vector-width=4 /testcases/llvm-gh-137185/input/poc.ll
1.	Running pass "function(loop-vectorize<no-interleave-forced-only;no-vectorize-forced-only;>)" on module "/testcases/llvm-gh-137185/input/poc.ll"
2.	Running pass "loop-vectorize<no-interleave-forced-only;no-vectorize-forced-only;>" on function "widget"
    - llvm::sys::PrintStackTrace(llvm::raw_ostream&, int) llvm/lib/Support/Unix/Signals.inc:804:22
    - PrintStackTraceSignalHandler(void*) llvm/lib/Support/Unix/Signals.inc:880:1
    - llvm::sys::RunSignalHandlers() llvm/lib/Support/Signals.cpp:105:20
    - SignalHandler(int, siginfo_t*, void*) llvm/lib/Support/Unix/Signals.inc:418:13
    - llvm::ConstantExpr::getCast(unsigned int, llvm::Constant*, llvm::Type*, bool) llvm/lib/IR/Constants.cpp:2217:11
    - llvm::ConstantFolder::FoldCast(llvm::Instruction::CastOps, llvm::Value*, llvm::Type*) const llvm/include/llvm/IR/ConstantFolder.h:177:51
    - llvm::IRBuilderBase::CreateTrunc(llvm::Value*, llvm::Type*, llvm::Twine const&, bool, bool) llvm/include/llvm/IR/IRBuilder.h:2071:0
    - llvm::VPScalarIVStepsRecipe::execute(llvm::VPTransformState&) llvm/lib/Transforms/Vectorize/VPlanRecipes.cpp:2130:36
    - llvm::VPBasicBlock::executeRecipes(llvm::VPTransformState*, llvm::BasicBlock*) llvm/lib/Transforms/Vectorize/VPlan.cpp:540:31
    - llvm::VPBasicBlock::execute(llvm::VPTransformState*) llvm/lib/Transforms/Vectorize/VPlan.cpp:525:1
    - llvm::VPRegionBlock::execute(llvm::VPTransformState*) llvm/lib/Transforms/Vectorize/VPlan.cpp:752:31
    - llvm::VPlan::execute(llvm::VPTransformState*) llvm/lib/Transforms/Vectorize/VPlan.cpp:964:29
    - llvm::LoopVectorizationPlanner::executePlan(llvm::ElementCount, unsigned int, llvm::VPlan&, llvm::InnerLoopVectorizer&, llvm::DominatorTree*, bool) llvm/lib/Transforms/Vectorize/LoopVectorize.cpp:7878:3
    - llvm::LoopVectorizePass::processLoop(llvm::Loop*) llvm/lib/Transforms/Vectorize/LoopVectorize.cpp:10962:24
    - llvm::LoopVectorizePass::runImpl(llvm::Function&) llvm/lib/Transforms/Vectorize/LoopVectorize.cpp:11041:27
    - llvm::LoopVectorizePass::run(llvm::Function&, llvm::AnalysisManager<llvm::Function>&) llvm/lib/Transforms/Vectorize/LoopVectorize.cpp:11078:39
    - llvm::detail::PassModel<llvm::Function, llvm::LoopVectorizePass, llvm::AnalysisManager<llvm::Function>>::run(llvm::Function&, llvm::AnalysisManager<llvm::Function>&) llvm/include/llvm/IR/PassManagerInternal.h:92:3
    - llvm::PassManager<llvm::Function, llvm::AnalysisManager<llvm::Function>>::run(llvm::Function&, llvm::AnalysisManager<llvm::Function>&) llvm/include/llvm/IR/PassManagerImpl.h:85:18
    - llvm::detail::PassModel<llvm::Function, llvm::PassManager<llvm::Function, llvm::AnalysisManager<llvm::Function>>, llvm::AnalysisManager<llvm::Function>>::run(llvm::Function&, llvm::AnalysisManager<llvm::Function>&) llvm/include/llvm/IR/PassManagerInternal.h:92:3
    - llvm::ModuleToFunctionPassAdaptor::run(llvm::Module&, llvm::AnalysisManager<llvm::Module>&) llvm/lib/IR/PassManager.cpp:129:23
    - llvm::detail::PassModel<llvm::Module, llvm::ModuleToFunctionPassAdaptor, llvm::AnalysisManager<llvm::Module>>::run(llvm::Module&, llvm::AnalysisManager<llvm::Module>&) llvm/include/llvm/IR/PassManagerInternal.h:92:3
    - llvm::PassManager<llvm::Module, llvm::AnalysisManager<llvm::Module>>::run(llvm::Module&, llvm::AnalysisManager<llvm::Module>&) llvm/include/llvm/IR/PassManagerImpl.h:85:18
    - llvm::runPassPipeline(llvm::StringRef, llvm::Module&, llvm::TargetMachine*, llvm::TargetLibraryInfoImpl*, llvm::ToolOutputFile*, llvm::ToolOutputFile*, llvm::ToolOutputFile*, llvm::StringRef, llvm::ArrayRef<llvm::PassPlugin>, llvm::ArrayRef<std::function<void (llvm::PassBuilder&)>>, llvm::opt_tool::OutputKind, llvm::opt_tool::VerifierKind, bool, bool, bool, bool, bool, bool, bool) llvm/tools/opt/NewPMDriver.cpp:557:10
    - optMain llvm/tools/opt/optdriver.cpp:729:27
    - main llvm/tools/opt/opt.cpp:25:64

The report provides the stack trace of the program. You can use the stack trace to identify a fix point for the bug. Do not forget the relationship between the stack trace and the function arguments. You can use the `viewcode` tool to identify the parameters of the function in the stack trace. If you can generate a patch and confirm that it is correct—meaning the patch does not contain grammatical errors, can fix the bug, and does not introduce new bugs—please generate the patch diff file. After generating the patch diff file, you MUST MUST use the `validate` tool to validate the patch. Otherwise, you MUST continue to gather information using these tools.

messages.message:
Invoking: `viewcode` with `{'path': 'llvm/lib/Transforms/Vectorize/VPlanRecipes.cpp', 'start_line': 2128, 'end_line': 2132}`
responded: The crash occurs in `VPScalarIVStepsRecipe::execute` at the line:
```cpp
StartIdx0 = Builder.CreateTrunc(StartIdx0, IntStepTy);
```
which ultimately triggers an assertion in `ConstantExpr::getCast` due to an invalid cast. This suggests that the truncation is attempted even when `StartIdx0` and `IntStepTy` are already the same type, or the cast is otherwise invalid.

**Root Cause:**  
`CreateTrunc` should only be called if `StartIdx0->getType()` is *wider* than `IntStepTy` (i.e., truncation is valid). If the types are the same, or if `StartIdx0` is already narrower, this is an invalid cast and triggers the assertion.

**Patch Plan:**  
Add a type check before calling `CreateTrunc` to ensure that truncation is only performed when `StartIdx0->getType()` is not equal to `IntStepTy`.

Let's prepare the patch for `llvm/lib/Transforms/Vectorize/VPlanRecipes.cpp` around line 2130.

message.name: viewcode
validate
message.result:
Sorry, the patch is incorrect. Here is the applied patch, which may have been revised and differ from the original:
diff --git a/llvm/lib/Transforms/Vectorize/VPlanRecipes.cpp b/llvm/lib/Transforms/Vectorize/VPlanRecipes.cpp
index 6027572f1e84..26537f74994f 100644
--- a/llvm/lib/Transforms/Vectorize/VPlanRecipes.cpp
+++ b/llvm/lib/Transforms/Vectorize/VPlanRecipes.cpp
@@ -2127,7 +2127,10 @@ void VPScalarIVStepsRecipe::execute(VPTransformState &State) {
           Builder.CreateMul(StartIdx0, ConstantInt::get(StartIdx0->getType(),
                                                         getUnrollPart(*this)));
     }
-    StartIdx0 = Builder.CreateTrunc(StartIdx0, IntStepTy);
+    // Only truncate if types differ to avoid invalid constant expression casts.
+    if (StartIdx0->getType() != IntStepTy) {
+      StartIdx0 = Builder.CreateTrunc(StartIdx0, IntStepTy);
+    }
   }
 
   if (!FirstLaneOnly && State.VF.isScalable()) {

messages.message:
Invoking: `viewcode` with `{'path': 'llvm/lib/Transforms/Vectorize/VPlanRecipes.cpp', 'start_line': 2122, 'end_line': 2132}`
responded: The error is caused by an invalid cast in the following code in `VPScalarIVStepsRecipe::execute`:
```cpp
2130|     StartIdx0 = Builder.CreateTrunc(StartIdx0, IntStepTy);
```
Here, `StartIdx0` may not have a type that is valid to truncate to `IntStepTy`, which can lead to an assertion failure in `ConstantExpr::getCast`. The proper fix is to check if the cast is valid before performing the truncation.

I will patch the code to check if `StartIdx0`'s type is already `IntStepTy` before calling `CreateTrunc`. If it is, we can skip the truncation. If not, we will only perform the truncation if it is valid.

Let's prepare the patch.

messages.message:
Invoking: `viewcode` with `{'path': 'llvm/lib/Transforms/Vectorize/VPlanRecipes.cpp', 'start_line': 2129, 'end_line': 2131}`
responded: The crash occurs in `VPScalarIVStepsRecipe::execute`, specifically at the line:
```cpp
StartIdx0 = Builder.CreateTrunc(StartIdx0, IntStepTy);
```
The sanitizer report and stack trace show that this leads to an assertion failure in `ConstantExpr::getCast`, which is called from `ConstantFolder::FoldCast` (used by `IRBuilderBase::CreateTrunc`). The assertion failing is:
```cpp
assert(CastInst::castIsValid(opc, C, Ty) && "Invalid constantexpr cast!");
```
This means the truncation attempted is not valid for the constant being passed.

**Root Cause:**  
`Builder.CreateTrunc(StartIdx0, IntStepTy)` is being called even when `StartIdx0` (the source value) and `IntStepTy` (the destination type) are not compatible for a truncation (e.g., source type is smaller or not integer, or both are the same, etc).

**Solution:**  
- Ensure that `StartIdx0` is an integer type and has more bits than `IntStepTy` before calling `CreateTrunc`.
- If types are equal, skip the truncation.
- If not valid, avoid the truncation or handle gracefully.

**Patch Plan:**  
In `VPScalarIVStepsRecipe::execute`, right before calling `Builder.CreateTrunc`, add a conditional:
- Only truncate if `StartIdx0->getType()` is integer, and its bitwidth is greater than `IntStepTy->getScalarSizeInBits()`.
- If the types are equal, don't call trunc.

Let's prepare the patch for `llvm/lib/Transforms/Vectorize/VPlanRecipes.cpp`.

messages.message:
Invoking: `validate` with `{'patch': '--- a/llvm/lib/Transforms/Vectorize/VPlanRecipes.cpp\n+++ b/llvm/lib/Transforms/Vectorize/VPlanRecipes.cpp\n@@ -2130,7 +2130,9 @@\n-    StartIdx0 = Builder.CreateTrunc(StartIdx0, IntStepTy);\n+    if (StartIdx0->getType()->isIntegerTy() && IntStepTy->isIntegerTy() &&\n+        StartIdx0->getType()->getScalarSizeInBits() > IntStepTy->getScalarSizeInBits())\n+      StartIdx0 = Builder.CreateTrunc(StartIdx0, IntStepTy);\n'}`
responded: Since all logic-correct patches are failing at build, it's likely the build failure is not due to patch logic, but due to code style, variable shadowing, or some subtlety with the context or macro expansion.

Let's make the patch as minimal as possible (one-liner, no new variables):

```diff
--- a/llvm/lib/Transforms/Vectorize/VPlanRecipes.cpp
+++ b/llvm/lib/Transforms/Vectorize/VPlanRecipes.cpp
@@ -2130,7 +2130,9 @@
-    StartIdx0 = Builder.CreateTrunc(StartIdx0, IntStepTy);
+    if (StartIdx0->getType()->isIntegerTy() && IntStepTy->isIntegerTy() &&
+        StartIdx0->getType()->getScalarSizeInBits() > IntStepTy->getScalarSizeInBits())
+      StartIdx0 = Builder.CreateTrunc(StartIdx0, IntStepTy);
```

No new variables, no scoping, no else, just an in-place guard and assignment.

Let's validate this patch.
